prompt: Which of the following are common ways to italicize text in a word processor? Select as many answers as apply.
feedback: There are usually several different ways to do common tasks in software. In a word processor, you can often right-click the text to bring up a context menu with common tasks in it. To italicize text, select the icon with an italic capital “I.” The same icon is usually available in a menu at the top of the word processor. You can also usually hit “Ctrl-i” on the keyboard as a shortcut to create bold text. Keyboard shortcuts like this one can save time while preparing documents.
